WARNING here please since client error 
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/DEVELOPING.md#logging-levels

Yes. This is the current backend limitation. I added that as a TODO in the comments. There is no backend to add multiple gateways now. Once we have that, then this can be an input with multiple IPv6 gateways as an array, and we can iterate through the list and create them one by one.
Sent out an email in the community to know if there are other views. We will push those changes soon at the backend and update this bmcweb part according to that as well.

> Yes. This is the current backend limitation. I added that as a TODO in the comments. There is no backend to add multiple gateways now.

That's fine, but the code needs to correctly handle setting only a single gateway.

> Once we have that, then this can be an input with multiple IPv6 gateways as an array, and we can iterate through the list and create them one by one.
> Sent out an email in the community to know if there are other views. We will push those changes soon at the backend and update this bmcweb part according to that as well.
If address is required, don't use an optional, and the core will handle this for you.

The above loop is not correct to the Redfish spec.  Namely:

1. It doesn't appear to support setting multiple gateways.
2. It doesn't support modification of the gateway array, through things like null and {}.

Please take a look at the code for ipv4 static, which handles all the conditions properly.

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/ethernet.hpp#L1242

For new code, please read out as a nlohmann::json::array_t.

Please also help to review: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61372
Update the test cases according to the new changes
This doesn't seem like a good thing to default to?
I don't think we should have any defaults?  This should be coming from the user, correct?

StaticRoute D-bus takes destination, gateway prefixLength & protocol as inputs which is generic D-bus call which can used to add static route and Ipv6 default gateway as well. 

for Gateway configuration user does not pass destination address so passed  0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0 as default values

xyz.openbmc_project.Network.StaticRoute.Create can creat an ipv6 gateway?  That seems like it would be xyz.openbmc_project.Network.Gateway.Create.

I'm not very comfortable having this default hardcoded in bmcweb.  If the service itself wants to pick a default, that's fine, it should expose a create API that only takes two arguments.

It should also be noted, I don't see a Create method here:
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Network/StaticRoute.interface.yaml

Sure Ed. I will check and see if backend can contain this. The create interface is at https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Network/StaticRoute/Create.interface.yaml
Gotcha, thanks for the pointer.  I still think this kind of logic needs to go in the backend, not bmcweb.
Ravi is reworking on the backend to get the relavant name and properties in the bus. So this commit will go through more changes after that.

Can you mark this as wip, I would if I had permissions :)
Either a wip topic tag or using Gerrit

I have updated D-bus interfaces and networkd implementation to address these comments
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-networkd/+/63033
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/69287
staticGatewayData? If you are going to have these, let's make sure they are correct
Can this loop be simplified with unpackPropertiesNoThow?
Please use sdbusplus::object_path for this, as we do everywhere else.
Pretty sure you meant to return here?
This code block looks identical to createIPv6DefaultGateway.  can you just call createIPv6DefaultGateway here?
Same question about the default here.
This is hardcoded here to use the common dbus interface StaticRoute for StaticGateway use case as well. The Destination address is 0 for the static gateway.
This should be an ArraySizeTooShort error?  The property value type is for if the type is incorrect.
This error is similar to how IPv4 and IPv6 patch request is handled.

I removed this whole block.  Technically not having an ipv6 gateway is allowed, and this would be what gets called if you want to delete all entries.

IPv4 and Ipv6 addresses aren't handled the same way, and even if they did, they're different semantics.
Should it be createFailedMissingReqProperties or propertyMissing error instead? I think the later one fits.
This actually shouldn't be anything.  This error is already set by readJson for you.

can we just do as:
addr = address?
Looks like what you pushed didn't build?
please use operator /=, which will escape properly.

I'm quite confused here...... Static routes and Gateways are different things (although similar).  Why is this creating a static route?  Shouldn't this be creating a gateway?

In terms of an API, bmcweb really should not be in charge of this abstraction.  It should be setting the gateway;  if inside phosphor-networkd, it wants to represent that as a set of static routes, it can, but managing a list of gateways as static routes seems difficult.

I agree with your point, static route and static gateways are different things.
we have tried to use existing static route interfaces for static gateway implementation which caused this confusion.
I have D-bus interfaces for staticGateway
Given that gateways need to have a priority, I see nothing that's conveying that priority to dbus.  How is that priority set up?

Priorities are not setup by the user as the user will not have the visibility to the current route table of the system. And it's risky to let the user set the route priority as well. This is left to the kernel.

> Priorities are not setup by the user

In redfish, they are set up by the order they exist in this list, right?

> And it's risky to let the user set the route priority as well. 

This isn't talking about route priority versus all kernel things, just priority of each gateway.

Hi Ed

By Defaults all IPv6 route default 1024 metric value, means all these gets same priority

Then how is the users order preserved or obeyed?

Additionally, because this is a Rest interface, that means that if I patch things in the two examples, it will reorder the list AFTER I've patched it.  It needs to return the same list (in the same order) as patched, per REST semantics.

Can you please try both of my examples and verify that the order is preserved?

If they all have the same metric, I'm ok with that (although I think it's incorrect, because it's random which one gets selected), but if the rest semantics around array ordering aren't obeyed, that's a problem, because redfish uses index quite often.

yes, That's right. redfish list should follow the same order as patched.
it applies to staticIPaddresses and other resources as well.
sure will verify both examples..
I could not get a setup to verify, will get this patch verified in a day or two

> user given order/redfish semantic order is taken care and it works

Do you understand functionally how that's accomplished in code?  I don't see anything that's setting an order on the bmcweb side, aside from the GetManagedObjects call, which technically could be in any order.

I guess if it works it's ok then.
yeah, don't need changes in BMCWEB, its handled in backend networkd D-bus object ordering.
That seems really brittle if we're relying on the dbus path order, but sure.
Does that mean you tested it and this patch works?
Yes it's tested with the networkd backend commit
nit, new code should pass by string view.
@sunitha, you've marked this ready to review, but a bunch of comments that are months old got ignored.  Can you comment on why that happened?

Hi Ed

That's my mistake, I have done rework on this commit as per latest D-bus changes and did not notice old outstanding comments
common error.  Please read and understand common_errors.md.
please use operator /=, which will escape properly here too

This looks like it only returns the first entry?  Shouldn't there be more than one gateway entry?

This is currently relying on the gateway entries to be in order.  I've fixed that.

One thing that I don't understand is that we're loading in the ID from the static data, and pulling in the iface from a different place.  That didn't look right to me, so I've changed it;  Please let me know if I did the right thing  I can't see how what was there could've worked as written, but maybe I had it wrong.
We will test this patch set for Delete operation.
On the other thread "Yes it's tested with the networkd backend commit"
Sunitha, I think I've resolved all the style things.  If you could retest, I would appreciate it.

Sure Ed, I will test this patch.
Thank you so much for fixing this commit
Thank you so much Ed. Retest is in progress
error_code  should be captured by const ref
This gateway looks duplicated?  Both gateways have the same address?
seems there is a difference of one char 2002:903 vs 2002:90
ACK, didn't see the change in char.
Giving other folks time to comment, but looks correct to me.

Networkd commit is not merged yet.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-networkd/+/63033
lets wait

What's the behavior if this goes in before the phosphor-networkd patch?  You just can't create ipv6 gateways and get an error when you do?  If that's all, I'm fine with this being on master.  Seems like we shouldn't need to wait in that case.
Yes Ed, The PATCH will fail and return error if there is no networkd backend. So I believe that this change can get merged and need not wait for the backend.
